title.english: Tying the Knot with an Amagami Sister

description:
Uryuu Kamihate is a high school student striving to enter Kyoto University’s medical school. After being raised at an orphanage, Uryuu is taken in by the chief priest at Amagami Shrine, where he begins to live as a freeloader—and to cohabit with Yae, Yuna, and Asahi, the three beautiful shrine maiden sisters! What’s more, the condition he must meet in order to live at the shrine for free is to marry into the family and inherit the shrine! How will Uryuu overcome his marriage meetings with the three sisters as well as the many challenges that Amagami Shrine faces? So begins a miraculous rom-com about living under the same roof with three shrine maidens!

(Source: Crunchyroll, edited)
synonyms: ด้ายแดงผูกรักบ้านอามากามิ

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Shrine Maiden
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a shrine maiden.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Time Loop
tags.description: A character is stuck in a repetitive cycle that they are attempting to break out of. This is distinct from a manipulating time of their own choice.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/marcey_naito) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/1061599)

He is a former assistant of the mangaka [Negi Haruba](https://anilist.co/staff/119140/).

Originating from [Studio Live](https://anilist.co/studio/6460/), where he studied under [Ashida Toyoo](https://anilist.co/staff/110953/).

He made his debut as in-betweener on [Manga Nihon Emaki](https://anilist.co/anime/9856/) and became a key animator on [Cyborg 009](https://anilist.co/anime/4690/) but it was his work as animation director on the [Minky Momo](https://anilist.co/anime/518/) series that brought him recognition and he was asked to draw illustrations of Momo. Subsequently he became the character designer for the later OVAs.

In 1986 he made his debut as director on [Kyoushoku Soukou Guyver](https://anilist.co/anime/2293/). Following some more work as animator he switched to directing in the beginning of the '90s. He is nowadays affiliated with [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/).

[Official Website](https://www.momoclo.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/momoclo_king_pr) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6YNWTm6zuMFsjqd0PO3G-Q)

Momoiro Clover Z (abbreviated Momoclo) is a four member idol girl group represented by Stardust Promotion under Section 3's 3Bjunior. The group was formed in 2008, originally under the name Momoiro Clover. The group gradually garnered popularity and fanbase following their single debut in 2009 and major debut in 2010.

They are known for their energetic and acrobatic performances, color-coded system and unconventional concepts. 

Their sister group is [Shiritsu Ebisu Chuugaku](https://anilist.co/staff/149421/Shiritsu-Ebisu-Chuugaku).

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Agency Profile](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=78) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Hondo_dagaya_)

A Japanese voice actor affiliated with I'm Enterprise.

Hondo had an interest in anime from a young age, in particular the [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/20/) series. She became interested in acting and modelling while in elementary school. She made her voice acting debut in 2015, and later that same year, she was cast in her first main role as [Kokoro Yotsuba](https://anilist.co/character/134716/), the protagonist of the anime series [Kamisama Minarai: Himitsu no Cocotama](https://anilist.co/anime/21237/).

She won Best New Actress at the 13th Seiyuu Awards for her role as [Hitomi Mishima](https://anilist.co/character/89230/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Lunalynn - Memento Mori (VG)
- Novel - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Ciel - Tsukihime -A piece of blue glass moon- (VN)
- Voyager - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Ajitani Hifumi - Blue Archive (VG)
- Phoebe - Wuthering Waves (VG) 
- Motoha Arai - Persona 5: The Phantom X (VG)

[Profile (Himawari)](https://profile.himawari.net/view/1595)

**Non-Anime Roles**
- Yunli - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Necrologist - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Lopera - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Ellen Joe - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)
- Tove - GODDESS OF VICTORY: NIKKE (VG)
- Lan Yan - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Owari - Azur Lane (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uesaka_official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/uesaka_sumire) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/uesakasumire) | [LINE Blog](https://lineblog.me/uesaka_sumire/) | [Record Label Profile](http://king-cr.jp/artist/uesakasumire/)

Sumire entered the entertainment industry at the age of 9, when she was scouted by Space Craft's junior talent division. In 2009, she landed her first regular radio gig as host of Web Raji@Dengeki Bunko, and in 2011, she transferred to animation division of Space Craft due her interest in becoming a voice actress. On March 12, 2016, Sumire received the Best Rookie Actress award in the 10th Seiyuu Awards. She has also been a member of the seiyuu unit ".lady." since 2014.

Sumire is fluent in Russian and loves the Soviet culture, which she became interested in after hearing the State Anthem of the USSR in her first year of high school. In April 2010, Sumire entered the Faculty of Foreign Studies at Sophia University, and she majored in the Russian language there.

Sumire is interested in history and war figurines, particularly Russian/Soviet history, the Showa era, and likes the book Romance of the Three Kingdoms. She also has had a strong interest in games, anime and manga ever since she was a child. Her other interests consists of photography, lolita fashion-- she works as a lolita model-- and drawing, which she is quite good at. She also loves rock and heavy metal; her favorite bands are Metallica, Judas Priest, Black Sabbath, Dragonforce, and Kinniku Shoujo Tai. Additionally, Sumire is very good friends with fellow seiyuu [Sachika Misawa](https://anilist.co/staff/102337/Sachika-Misawa), who has called Sumire "her waifu".

**Non-anime roles:**
- Rosalie - Memento Mori (VG)
- Exia - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Drake - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)

[Website](https://www.mattgreenbaumvo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mattsgreenbaum) 

American voice actor and ADR writer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/caitlinsvoice) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/caitlinsvoice/) | [Myspace](https://myspace.com/caitlintiffany) | [Blog](https://kiristokyoto.livejournal.com/)

An American voice actor, voice director, and script writer for Funimation, New Generation Pictures, and Bang Zoom! Entertainment. She's been working in the anime industry since 2004. She grew up in the San Diego area, California, and has been married to Tony Patterson since 2009. Outside of voice acting, Caitlin has worked as an ESL teacher in Spain.
Samantha Herek is a producer and actress.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/629551696)

Affiliated with EXPLOSION.

Has a twin brother named [Naoki Etou](https://anilist.co/staff/146123) in the animation industry.
Kimura Kashiko is an editor working for Mad Box.
Megan Shipman is an American voice actress.
